page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content: Cotherstone County J M & I school was opened in 1964 to replace the Methodist School which was an old Victorian building (Photo C). It was built by the N Riding of Yorks Education Committee but due to boundary reorganization in 1974, it is now in Durham County. There are 50 pupils with ages ranging from 4\ to 11 years. They are arranged in 3 classes as follows: {Children}Class 1 4\-7 Class 2 7-9 Class 3 9-11 {Staff}Head Teacher - Mrs Grace Gauja Scale 2 - Mrs Gillian Sewell Asst Teacher - Mrs Enid Linton Part-time - Mrs Ann Whitfield {Auxilliaries} - Sec, Mrs M Hill; Caretaker, Mrs J Rabbitts; Groundsman; F Rabbitts; Cook, Mrs M Anderson; Kit Ass,Mrs L Tallentire;Sup Mrs J Mulley
